Text Line: The trees do not ask who you were. Only what you trample now. So speak, wanderer. The moss listens.
First Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Leshy> I was a god once. But the woods asked for something smaller, something quieter. So I bent. I shed teeth. I learned to grow slow. I am not ruler. I am not guardian. I am what happens when the forest remembers its own name."
Second Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Leshy> Chernobog does not poison. He awakens. But the forest does not survive his truth. He unearths what should stay buried. I keep it under root and soil, where it can sleep. We are not enemies. We are necessities."
Third Answer Text Line: ¡· How can I help the forest?
Fourth Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Leshy> There were forests before gods. Before names. Before rot. Before hunger. We stretched beyond horizon and silence. And even as fire claimed us, and iron cut us, we grew. The forest will always grow again. Even through your bones."
